intro: Isonandra rufa, commonly known as the red-flowered isonandra, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red petals and hairy stems. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both horticulturists and botanists.
